base.commit_message:
ipv6: Support peer address

When using with IPv6 peer address, nispor is incorrectly treating peer
address as local.

In kernel, we have netlink code of ipv6 address which store peer address
to `IFA_ADDRESS` and local address to `IFA_LOCAL`.

```c
if (!ipv6_addr_any(&ifa->peer_addr)) {
	if (nla_put_in6_addr(skb, IFA_LOCAL, &ifa->addr) < 0 ||
	    nla_put_in6_addr(skb, IFA_ADDRESS, &ifa->peer_addr) < 0)
		goto error;
} else
	if (nla_put_in6_addr(skb, IFA_ADDRESS, &ifa->addr) < 0)
		goto error;
```

This patch fixed it by introducing new property to ipv6 address: `peer`
and `peer_prefix_len`. YAML example for command
`ip -6 addr add 2001:db8:f::1/128 peer 2001:db8:f::2/64 dev eth1`

```yml
  - address: "2001:db8:f::1"
    prefix_len: 128
    valid_lft: forever
    preferred_lft: forever
    flags:
    - permanent
    peer: 2001:db8:f::2
    peer_prefix_len: 64
```

Integration test case included.

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

ipv6: Support query ipv6 address flags

Introduce `Ipv6AddrInfo::flags` as `Vec<Ipv6AddrFlag>`.

Example:

```yml
- name: veth1
  iface_type: veth
  state: up
  ipv6:
    addresses:
    - address: fe80::223:45ff:fe67:891a
      prefix_len: 64
      valid_lft: forever
      preferred_lft: forever
      flags:
      - permanent
```

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

CI: Enable VRF and ethool pause test

With latest ubuntu 6.2.0-1011-azure kernel and extra modules, VRF and
ethtool pause(using netdevsim) is supported.

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

CI: Upgrade the version of github action tasks

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

test: Fix ethtool link mode test on Ubuntu

With Ubuntu kernel 6.2.0-1011-azure, the link speed of a TUN interface
is 10000Mb/s while RHEL kernel is 10Mb/s. Hence we check on speed for
bigger or equal to 10.

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

Github CI: Install extra module of running kernel

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

macsec: add base_iface property

MACsec needs a base_iface to be created. show the `base_iface` for its
parent.

Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

macsec: add MACsec interface support

Add support to showing MACsec interface information.

cli: Upgrade to clap 4.2

dependency: Bump `env_logger` to 0.10.0

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

route: Fallback to user space filter when kernel filter failed

As reported in https://github.com/nmstate/kubernetes-nmstate/issues/1174
Ubuntu kernel somehow cannot use `NETLINK_GET_STRICT_CHK` for kernel
space route filter.

This patch will fallback to userspace route filter when
`NETLINK_GET_STRICT_CHK` failed.

No idea how to simulate a `NETLINK_GET_STRICT_CHK` failure, hence no
auto test case for CI.

Manually change code to fail the `NETLINK_GET_STRICT_CHK` and confirmed
user space route filter works well.

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>

Enable `Copy` trait for VlanProtocol

Signed-off-by: Gris Ge <fge@redhat.com>
